genetic.mazesolver

    • Constructor Detail

      • PathIndividual

        public PathIndividual(java.lang.Integer[][] maze,
                      int startX,
                      int startY)
        Constructor for the class. Sets the attributes related to the problem that has to be solved.
        Calls the super-constructor specifying that the number of genes must be the longest possible move without loops inside the maze. That is, the number of genes is width*height of the maze.
        Parameters:
        maze - Matrix representing the maze. Contains free spots and walls.
        startX - Start row.
        startY - Start column.

    • Method Detail

      • generateRandomGene

        public java.lang.Integer generateRandomGene()
        Generates a random direction represented as a number.
        While the move may not be valid, this is not checked here but afterwards.
        Specified by:
        generateRandomGene in class Individual
        Returns:
        A new, randomly generated gene represented as an integer.

      • fitness

        public int fitness(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> coordinates)
        Computes the fitness of an individual given the desired solution. The higher the number, the more fit the individual.
        The fitness here is calculated according to how close to the exit the path generated leads in the maze. If at any point a move is invalid, the calculation stops and the value returned corresponds to the best score the valid part of the path got.
        If a valid part of the path actually gets to the exit, the fitness is increased based on how short the path is, this way the algorithm attempts to not only get to exit, but also get there as quick as possible.
        After the fitness has been calculated, the number of steps that is required to get to the best part of the path is recorded in the number of genes attribute to explicit the fact that only up to that point the path is relevant.
        Overrides:
        fitness in class Individual
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Exit's coordinates.
        Returns:
        Fitness of the individual.

      • isPositionValid

        private boolean isPositionValid(int x,
                                int y)
        Checks if a given position is valid, that is, if it's inside the maze's boundaries.
        Parameters:
        x - Row coordinates to be checked.
        y - Column coordinate to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if the position is valid. False otherwise.
